questions.question_text: A user's corporate phone was stolen, and the device contains company trade secrets. Which of the following technologies should be implemented to mitigate this risk? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
A - Remote wipe ensures the data is wiped regardless of where you are in the world.

C - If somehow someone were to copy data off the phone, it won't be readable/usable without the encryption key.

questions.question_text: A user visits a game vendor's website to view the latest patch notes, but this information is not available on the page. Which of the following should the user perform before reloading the page?

discussion.content: User clearing the cache does not make sense at all, it is not going to change anything on the VENDOR's Website, the Vender should clear his web cache. The Question states the information is not available on the Vendor's site . It has got nothing to do with user clearing his cache., how can the answer be D? Can somebdy perhaps explain this?

comments.content: None of the other options would do anything on the vendors side either. It's implied that the prior version is cached locally and being loaded instead of the new one, so the answer is D.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Sometimes, a web page may not load correctly due to outdated or corrupted files in the browser’s cache. Clearing the cache can force the browser to download fresh copies of the web page’s files, which may resolve the issue.

Selected Answer: D
None of the other answers make sense except D.

Selected Answer: D
D. Clear the cached file.

If a user is not seeing the latest content on a website, including patch notes, it could be due to the browser caching the previous version of the page. To ensure the user gets the most up-to-date information, they should clear the cached files in their browser.

questions.question_text:
A user receives the following error while attempting to boot a computer:


BOOTMGR is missing -

Press Ctrl+Alt+Del to restart -

Which of the following should a desktop engineer attempt first to address this issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Repair Windows.

The error message "BOOTMGR is missing" typically indicates an issue with the boot manager files on the computer. In such a situation, attempting to repair Windows is a common and effective first step to address the problem.

To repair Windows, a desktop engineer can use the Windows installation media (DVD or USB) and access the repair options, such as the Startup Repair tool.
The Startup Repair tool will attempt to fix any issues with the boot manager, and it's a common method for resolving "BOOTMGR is missing" errors.

Selected Answer: A
Only logical is to repair window or repair system so A

questions.question_text:
A technician is investigating an employee's smartphone that has the following symptoms:
✑ The device is hot, even when it is not in use.
✑ Applications crash, especially when others are launched.
✑ Certain applications, such as GPS, are in portrait mode when they should be in landscape mode.
Which of the following can the technician do to MOST likely resolve these issues with minimal impact? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
E and F makes the most logical sense for this question because that would be the end all be all solution for this question. However, the question states "minimal impact" making me believe the answers would be A and C.

comments.content: Why would I reinstall an app that is on default settings?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AC
The question asks for minimal impact so closing unnecessary apps would make sense. None of the other answers would fix the landscape/portrait problem with the phone other than option A.

How can it be "A" when it stated certain as applications such as GPS doesn't rotate...this implies that certain application the rotation is working fine therefore "autorotate" is already on. Answer is probably C and F

Selected Answer: AC
Minimal impact

Selected Answer: CE
Close unnecessary applications.
Update the device's operating system.

Selected Answer: AC
I think who answer that was not able to see the word Minimal impact :)

Selected Answer: AC
Minimal impact on the device/end-user is the key here.

Selected Answer: CE
These two answer choices (CE) are going to help you out with 100% of the problem you are facing. Only while answer choice A is going to help you out with 1 of the 3 problems.

Selected Answer: AC
Turn on autorotate, close any unwanted apps according to minimal impact
A & C illicit minimal impact to the user.

Selected Answer: AC
Minimal impact: enable autorotation and closing apps would cause the least impact.

Selected Answer: CE
C. Close unnecessary applications: Closing unnecessary applications can help free up system resources and potentially resolve performance and crashing issues. Background applications can contribute to the device becoming hot and unstable.

E. Update the device's operating system: Outdated operating systems can sometimes lead to performance issues, crashes, and compatibility problems. Updating the operating system can help fix bugs and improve overall stability.
The key phrase in the question is "minimal impact". That is why 'D' is not correct since it would result with the loss of all data.
Funny how no one can really agree on the answer because the question is honestly just bad and confusing. Classic comptia

Selected Answer: CE
C. Close unnecessary applications: Closing unnecessary applications can help free up system resources, which may cause the device to overheat and lead to application crashes.

E. Update the device's operating system: Updating the operating system can address potential bugs and compatibility issues that may be causing the GPS app to malfunction in portrait mode when it should be in landscape mode. It can also manage other software-related issues that could be contributing to the problems.
the answer is C and E.

Selected Answer: CE
The symptoms suggest that the employee's smartphone is experiencing performance issues. Closing unnecessary applications can help free up resources and reduce the strain on the phone's hardware, which can help alleviate the overheating and crashing issues. Updating the device's operating system can also address potential software bugs and security vulnerabilities that could be contributing to the symptoms.
Activating airplane mode would disable all wireless communications on the device, which might not be an ideal solution if the employee needs to use the phone for work purposes. Performing a factory reset would wipe all data and settings on the device, which is a drastic action that should only be taken as a last resort. Reinstalling the specific applications that have crashed may help resolve the issue with those apps, but it may not address the root cause of the overall performance issues. Finally, turning on autorotation may be a minor fix for the portrait/landscape mode issue, but it is unlikely to resolve the other symptoms.

comments.content:
How does updating the OS address the screen orientation issue? You have only dealt with 50% of the problem.

Turning on autorotation would ABSOLUTELY "address the underlying issue".

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CE
C. Close unnecessary applications and E. Update the device's operating system would be the best steps the technician can take to most likely resolve these issues with minimal impact. Closing unnecessary applications can help free up resources on the smartphone, which may be causing the device to become hot and causing applications to crash. Updating the device's operating system can help fix any known issues or vulnerabilities that may be causing the symptoms. Turning on autorotation, activating airplane mode, performing a factory reset, and reinstalling the applications that have crashed may not necessarily address the underlying issue and may even cause additional issues or data loss.

Selected Answer: AC
Definitely A&C. Fix autorotation on apps. It says "especially when other apps are running", implying the user just has too many apps open at once, making the phone run hot and crashing other apps. It specifies minimal impact.

Selected Answer: AC
they r talking about screen orientation..

comments.content: Thats funny, because I just asked it and it said C & E. Guess it changed its mind lol
D makes no sense because if you factory reset the device, it'll delete all of the user's data and info. I really don't know why that would even be a considerable choice.
No, ChatGPT picked 2 answers based on probability.

discussion.content: Since there were too many different answers on this, I ran it through ChatGPT and it says C and D are the correct choices

Selected Answer: AC
AC are the ones with minimal impact, then if that doesnt work, proceed with the harder impact.

Selected Answer: CE
C. Closing unnecessary applications can help free up system resources and reduce the device's heat. This can also help reduce application crashes, as there are more system resources available for the applications that are running.

E. Updating the device's operating system can help resolve issues related to software bugs and performance, which may be causing the device to overheat and applications to crash. This can also address issues with application orientation. It is recommended to keep the device's operating system up to date to ensure optimal performance and security.

comments.content: apps also run in the background, doesnt mean if the phone has not been touched the apps will stop working too. apps are always running in the background. eg: Email Apps they still run in the back even if the user does not have it opened.

discussion.content: So what about the first issue" the phone getting hot even if not in use" this means there no applications opened ,how is that get fixed?
"Minimal impact" is the key here. While more drastic measures may be necessary, performing A and C would have extremely low impact on the end user and are suitable first steps.

Selected Answer: EF
I feel like D would only work if you knew I was all backed up
I agree to choose D and E--as the Quest ask for the MOST effective solution, asif once and for all solution. Also there is no Cost and Time, or any thing states to keep the phone's data.

A doesn't make sense because it clearly states "Certain applications are in portrait mode." B does nothing. C makes sense. D is overkill. E makes sense because some of the issues would be fixed if the device was updated. F does not always work.

Selected Answer: AC
Definitely A and C. The suggested answers are far from "least impactful" which the problem requires.
C would do absolutely nothing positive, as it has been proven many times that all it does is increase the ram usage upon reopening.
Why is it not A and C?
anyone know why they chose D as performing a factory reset seems like that would have a big impact and not minimal as the question is asking

Selected Answer: EF
Dont reset my phone for crashing apps.

choices.F: Reinstall the applications that have crashed.

questions.question_text: A technician is working on a way to register all employee badges and associated computer IDs. Which of the following options should the technician use in order to achieve this objective?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. Database system

To register all employee badges and associated computer IDs, the most appropriate option is to use a Database system.

Explanation:

Database system (Option A): A database system allows for the organized storage, retrieval, and management of data. In this case, the database can store information about employee badges and their associated computer IDs, providing a structured and efficient way to manage this information.
